4No lifts and were very very slow.

title: Not a Very Good Experience
text: It was supposed to be a very good trip , but with all the problems I got as no hot water in the room, employees not educated and with no will to assist us, I was waiting the best time for my wife 50th anniversary

title: The place to stay
text: I loved staying at this hotel. The location was perfect and very safe. Staff friendly and nice. The rooms super comfortable. Plus, there are plenty of options if you want to dine in. I can’t wait to stay here again.

title: Good introduction to New York
text:
New York, is, probably, the most interesting city in the US. Manhattan is crowded. There are millions of tourist walking, shopping and doing everything you can imagine. I liked the that mixture of of old and new buildings, the elegance of the city, the pizza...
The weather is no so good in November; it rains and it is cold. The city It is terrible expensive so, better plan your trip a little and put a limit on your expenses; the money always goes quickly and comes slowly but in New York it simply disappear before you can look how much you have.
The Hotel is just in the right place; when you leave to the street you are in the center, just where you what to be.
The room was clean... perfect. It was always impeccable.
The personnel are typical New Yorkers; They are open, friendly, funny. They help a lot and you always feel welcome. I had a lot of fun with them.
The breakfast was a good NY style, but expensive; maybe a little more options would be needed.

Overall...Excellent; I liked everything and I am very happy with my trip and all that i experienced in this hotel and in the city.

title: They charge money on the credit card
text: Very bad service, not a 5 stars hotel. They charge you cost without any advice and the receptionist gave me a very quick answer without really care. Breakfast very expenive without any reason and few common spaces

title: Absolutely Perfect
text: My boyfriend got a Thanksgiving / Holiday package! We highly recommend. Michael the concierge was amazing. The package we had got us VIP in the observatory, 11 rows from the stage of the Christmas Spectacular and A coffee and pastry at The Rock shop in the hotel. This Hotel in the heart of it all, we walked to the show, the observatory, a couple bars, Rockefeller center and so much more.. We will definitely be back.

title: Great hotel
text: Our family trip was to NYC for 7 days. We though the hotel was nice and clean. Staff was excellent and always accommodating. Hotel is close to everything in Manhattan! We will stay again on our next trip to NYC.

title: Loved this hotel
text: Loved everything about this hotel. It’s a gorgeous property steps away from Times Square. But stepping through the doors, you’re taken out of the rush of nyc into a luxury boutique hotel experience. The decor is sleek and modern. Service is attentive and friendly. The rooms are awesome, with luxury shower heads and pre-set mood lighting. And they’re quiet! Blackout shades and sound-proof windows blocked out the city streets. Lavazza espresso maker in-room was an awesome touch.

title: Thanksgiving/Macy's Day Parade visit
text:
Miguel and the other gentlemen that helped us with bringing our luggage down and getting it into the car while we were gone to see one more thing were amazing! 

The overall friendliness, professionalism, and genuine want to be at work shined through in every employee that we encountered.  

We arrived early for check in, rooms were ready and next to each other like requested.  Rooms are very clean as well as bathrooms.  Housekeeping is great.  Push the green button and they will come up and take care of anything you want.  The red button means do not disturb.  I learned this on accident.  The housekeeper came to the room because I had the green light on.  

First night we stopped on the second level for drinks at Session Bar.  Great service on Wednesday night.  We up to RT60 to check out the views.  They have blankets and heaters for a great night out.  

Thanksgiving we ate at NYY!  Love the décor!  Service was wonderful and so was the food!  

The location is the best. Turn left out of the door and you are half a block from Times Square.  Turn Right and there is 6th Ave/Ave of the Americas.  Several blocks down is Radio City and Rockefeller Center.  Easy walk to Central Park.  

I would definitely stay there again. The hotel is on a side street, no noise from horns.

title: Missed the mark
text: We stayed here for 7 nights in November. Arrival was great, we were greeted and helped with our bags. We checked in fine and went to our room. Bags were delivered to us. Room was quite small but clean and well presented. Furnishings were lovely and the bed was very comfy. The air con is a nightmare. You switch it off and it just keeps coming on throughout the night and it’s really loud. We had room service breakfast twice which was nice. We ate breakfast in the restaurant once and it took almost an hour for our food to come (French toast, eggs, 1 sausage and potatoes). The hotel breakfast is so expensive and really not worth it. Room service was great for a change but head out to eat. We went to the rooftop bar on the Saturday evening but it was full, so we left and made a reservation for the following evening. It was nice but the music is very loud so don’t go here if you plan to have conversations with your companions. The staff across the hotel were really friendly and helpful so no complaints. Our room was cleaned daily and had fresh towels and toiletries which was great. We had to pay a “service charge” of around €380 for the use of the gym, the coffee machine and the wifi which is crazy money. We didn’t use the gym, we were barely in the room to use the wifi and the coffee should be complimentary. We’d rather not have the machine and avoid the charge given for it. Overall, we rate it a 4* because for the price it cost us, we didn’t get a service or experience to match. You’re paying for the “hard rock” experience but really it’s just a bunch of memorabilia on the wall that you can see by going into the Hard Rock Cafe for dinner.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Such an amazing hotel just a few blocks from Time Square. Very clean. Customer service is amazing and accommodated all my requests. Bed is so comfy and heated floors in the restroom is such a nice touch.

title: My NY parade trip
text: Best service that I have gotten at any hotel.  My wife on a trip to NY a month ago was helped by the valet while she was walking by and could not get a cab.    Because of that service we booked with them for this trip.    Will not disappoint.  Great service, speed and knowledge. Will book here again

title: Location, Friendly Team, Cool Vibes
text: It’s tough to beat this location. We were able to walk to 75% of our plans. The staff was attentive and friendly. Rooms super cool - we had a massive Bruce Springsteen in ours😍 Would stay here again!

title: 10/10 great experience
text: Hotel was extremely clean & well maintained and roomy vs other hotels in this price range. Also, the hotel was central to many of the activities we did offering us a good space to use the restroom & take short rest breaks! Staff were all friendly & helpful! Great experience & made our holiday visit pleasant!

title: NYC the Hard Rock way
text: great location for people who want to be in Times Square area. Hotel is clean and new. stayed in a suite on the 33rd floor. great space! Loved the bathroom set up, full tub and spacious shower. Heated floors in the bathroom was a pleasant surprise.

title: Hidden fees
text: No mention when booking the room there would be another $40.00 plus taxes fee per day when checking out.  To me that’s deceptive advertising and unfair business practices.  It probably wouldn’t have affected my decision to stay but was annoying.

title: Overall, great experience and good care.
text: We stayed here one night after seeing a show. Initially, I wrote a mediocre review critical of how a fire alarm in the middle of the night was not addressed. Well, I stand corrected. The manager was fantastic. He reached out to me personally and offered some compensation for our blemished experience. Truly impressive gesture. We will be returning. The place was beautiful and I feel more care from them at this point which we appreciate.

title: Highly recommend, perfect for location.
text:
Excellent location, spotlessly clean, great to have the coffee shop downstairs. All staff friendly and helpful. Modern feel with nice musical touches everywhere. 
Room was a little on the small side but normal for NYC. 
Perfect particularly if it’s your first trip to NYC as the location lends itself to familiarity with the city.

title: Excellent stay
text: Hotel is amazing, clean and staff very friendly. Cannot wait to return. The bed is the most comfortable bed I’ve ever been in in a hotel! Perfect location for seeing New York, hotel is right at the start of Times Square.

title: Rockettes Show and a FUN hotel! Merry Christmas NYC
text: Jasna at the desk was wonderful at check in! Rooms are full of new gadgets. The refrigerator is in a drawer. The shower is big and offers two shower types. The music is always playing in the hotel and it makes a vibe that is fun! We are here to see the Radio city Christmas show /Rockefeller center which is 2 blocks away. I have a partial view of Times Square and like others say it is quiet to sleep. The roofbar is beautiful. Everything is new (6 months)and shiny. I paid $275 and the rooms are small but it is New York. The hotel seems like an attraction in itself.

title: Nice hotel; poor handling of fire alarm
text:
We enjoyed our seat at the Hard Rock Hotel overall. The rooms seem new and well taken care of. 

However, we had an issue arise that was not handled well. On our 2nd night,  a fire alarm went off in our room around 1:30am. After waiting a few minutes and hearing nothing, my wife and I decided to get out of bed, get dressed and head down the 27 flights of stairs.  By the time we got out to the street and walked back into the lobby, the manager was telling us that we needed to go back upstairs and that we shouldn’t have come down, and that it was just a faulty smoke head. Apparently he had made an announcement while we were coming down the stairs, but this couldn’t be heard from the stairwell. We went back up to our room and got back in bed, only to have the alarm go off again 10 minutes later. We waited for an announcement, but got nothing. Eventually I went back downstairs to ask what was going on. A hotel employee told me that everything was fine, and that someone had pulled the alarm by mistake. This was a different story than I got the first time which was a bit disconcerting. But nonetheless I went back upstairs to bed. About 10 minutes later, the alarm went off again. Once again, there was no announcement to reassure us that everything was fine, leaving us wondering what to do.  I was finally able to call the front desk after multiple attempts, and they told us they were trying to get it turned off and that everything was fine. 

This whole experience was very disruptive and poorly managed. I understand that alarms can go off, but this was not managed well to provide reassurance to guests of their safety. It resulted in us losing several hours of sleep that night, which was the night prior to the NYC marathon which was why we came to NYC for this trip.  

To make matters worse, around 8am the next morning, the alarm went off again for about 5 minutes. We again wondered what to do, and someone finally came on to say they were testing the system, but not until 10 minutes or so after the alarm went off. 

This experience was very disappointing in what was otherwise a good experience at the hotel.

title: Must stay.
text: Best hotel experience in NYC. I have stayed at multiple properties in Midtown, this hotel is by far the cleanest and offers the best amenities. Also, RT60 roof top is a hidden gem, a must if you are staying at hard rock!

title: Visiting NYC during Thanksgiving Holliday!
text: Everything was great. Staffs were helpful, especially Neilyn was nice and hospitable .Breakfast was delicous .overall I had a great exprience. The room was wonderful,clean. Front desk staff is extremely efficient pleasent and helpful.

title: Great Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: Amazing hotel located at Times Square. Quiet and comfortable with a staff that truly cares about your experience. Great atmosphere, clean, and safe, just steps away from numerous must-see locations. Highly recommend this hotel. We are already planning a trip back!

title: Hard Rock
text: I received the greatest service at the Hard Rock store. Mark from the rock shop was awesome 👌 He gave the extra mile to help me find a special gift for my boyfriend, the Freddy Mercury limited edition tshirt.

title: Best Stay in Times Sq
text:
Best stay, clean rooms, amazing and accommodating staff and picturesque interiors! 

Huge beds, enough to sleep 3 people, bathroom could be bigger, and room a little brighter, with more mirrors. 

Just on time Sq, but not on the main road, so you have a little bit of privacy.

title: Outstanding Stay and Performance of Staff
text: The staff and crew at the Hard Rock Hotel really made me feel special. They rolled out the red carpet for me and make sure that my stay at the Hard Rock was an exceptional one. The hotel aesthetics and design is highly desirable. It is centrally located in times square, but it's location on 48th Street helped minimize the droves of tourists and foot traffic. The hotel staff are friendly and the hotel is very clean.

title: Overpriced, not safety focused
text:
Hotel itself is ok, not really anything special and room though comfortable is a squeeze if you have anything other than a carry on suitcase for a longer stay. 
Stay was ruined by (false alarm) fire alarms in the middle of the night, with very poor communication or management of the issue from hotel staff including no alert to emergency services and inaudible alarm announcements in corridors and zero in the escape stairwell. Very poor. Will never stay here again.

title: Excellent
text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and has great customer service. The food and drinks are good. The rooftop bar and lounge is a plus along with the entertainment was really nice. I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely be coming back to stay again.

title: Great Customer Service
text:
This was the first time at Hard Rock Hotel and had to share what a great experience I had at this establishment. 

Started rocky as I was checking in early morning and realized I lost my license and JC (Kanye) walked me through what I needed to do and while I was on the phone with Hotel.com, JC printed out what I needed to do at the airport to return home. 

Knowing Check in wasn’t until 3pm we were expecting to leave our luggage with the Concierge.  To our surprise JC said our room was available and was able to settle in before exploring the Big Apple. 

Best part was getting a phone call from the airline letting me know my license was found and can be picked up when returning home. 

I cannot say enough how helpful the staff were guiding us around the town and getting us to the right subways.  

Thank you Hard Rock Hotel for a great positive experience and will be signing up for the rewards program. 

Karen

title: Great location and very friendly staff
text: Great location and very friendly.  The dinning and other in hotel entertainment was great. The hotel is close to public transportation. The check-out time is 12pm, which is much later than most hotels I have been to.  I will visit this hotel when I travel to this area again.

title: In the Heart of Times Square
text: Quiet, comfortable and spacious room. Couldn't be more central in Times Square. Reception and doormen so friendly and helpful. A little more expensive than some other hotels we looked at in the area but worth the extra expense after a 3 year travel break. We did skip the €50 breakfast option though. We will definitely be back !

title: Perfect luxury hotel
text: This hotel is brand new, spectacular with a perfect location on 48 street. No noise from Times square just beside. 2 minutes from radio city and rockfeller ice rink ! The hotel vas very good soundproofing with high level of windows. It’s peaceful especially on the back of the hotel. The staff is really nice and friendly (thanks juvilia N.). Don’t hesitate événement if you are not fan hard rock.

title: Padrão Mediano
text:
Localização é o ponto principal de destaque.
Check in e out rapidos, mas atendentes desinteressadas no processo.
Quartos pequenos, pouco/nenhum espaço para malas.
NYY steak tem preços altos mesmo para NY. Atendimento lento, quantidade pequena e salada com tempero ruim. Não parece ter relação com o hotel, apenas estar no mesmo prédio.
Session, tentamos tomar café da manhã, sem sucesso. Garçom não veio atender. Front desk desinteressada no problema.
Para almoço e jantar no Session tudo ok. 
Pessoal que cuida das malas, interessado em vender transfer para aeroporto e pouco interessado nas malas. Ao chegar no hotel, ninguém veio ajudar a tirar malas do carro. Apenas já dentro do elevador vieram oferecer ajuda.
Recepção do hotel é no segundo andar.

title: Cool hotel, great location but VERY noisy air flow
text:
We were only here for one night so didn’t really get to experience  everything the hotel had to offer but we’re avid Hard Rock fans so didn’t want to miss out on the opportunity to stay here. 
We were on the 14th floor with a room at the front from which you could see Times Square but you couldn’t really hear the noise which was great. Also had proper blackout blinds that are attached to the frame so there’s no gaps for light to get through. The room itself was really nice and loved how it was decorated. 
BUT the air flow system made so much noise. I’m not talking about the aircon, that we turned off but the vent that’s above the sliding door you couldn’t turn off. I’m not usually one to be bothered by noises like that but this was ridiculous. 
We called down to reception to ask for it to be turned off but were told it was a requirement and they couldn’t do anything about it. The man my husband spoke to was very nice and apologetic but ultimately all he could suggest was ear plugs! Not a great night’s sleep unfortunately. 
We did mention it on check-out and the lady there was very nice about it too and knocked off one of the various taxes they usually charge you for (think it was about $50) so they did acknowledge it and offer compensation, I feel like it was that bad that I couldn’t stay there again.

title: Hidden $45/per Nt.Fees!, Terrible Cust.Service.
text: They charge you a hidden $45 per night resident fee (Not Resort fee!) that was NOT disclosed and no one from the front desk or even the managers reply to you to help you address any of your concerns for anything. No promises are fulfilled & Hospitality is Non-Existent.

title: Great Stay
text: Great staff, fantastic restaurants and beautiful property in an amazing location. NYY Steaks has an amazing staff and menu. RT 60, the roof top venue has awesome views with a great staff and drinks. Its a must vist.

title: Excellent accommodations and service
text: I stayed for a week and experienced a lot of what the hotel had to offer. The rooms are great and the service is excellent. Fewer hotels, have coffee makers in the room and they  provide excellent coffee. The gym had a nice combination of weights and cardio. One of the better weightlifting selections I have seen.

title: Pleasantly surprised - Keep up the good work
text: Booked as a work trip for somewhere to stay.  I would splurge on the biggest room you can afford.  The Deluxe King was snug and I was not able to take advantage of the complimentary yoga mat as there was not enough room to stretch my arms!  Next time I stay, I will ask for a room on a higher floor and away from the elevator.  Staff were super friendly and efficient.  Kettle and extra toiletries delivered immediately.  We enjoyed the rooftop bar but we did not eat at the hotel.  We had an issue with a fire alarm the first night that had us up.  However, front desk in the morning were quick to offer us compensation for that.  HRH has a good vibe about it and as it was so close to the office - will stay there again.

title: World Class Hospitality
text: I'm a big music fan, but had never been to a Hard Rock. I only stayed here because I was at the Nintendo Store and wanted to put all my stuff down, but every aspect of the experience was perfect. I would especially like to highlight the service I received at the cafe/gift shop (bought a guitar from there and the employees were with me every step of the process) and at the valet.

title: NYC  Pleasure & watch UFC 281 at MSG
text: Our experience there was superb from the minute me and my wife got there. Adi - Johnathan - Miguel G  Thank.You. You guys rock and so does the rest of your crew I had the pleasure to encounter. Definitely won’t be our last visit in the NYC so we will definitely circle back to the Hard Rock Hotel! Thanks guys your friend from chicago vini #1601

title: Perfect midtown destination
text: Great hotel and awesome service, we even had a view of the Hudson River! Very welcoming staff, super clean modern rooms and fun pop rock memorabilia. Perfect location if you are planning theatre and midtown museums outings.  The valet service made parking easy.

title: Hard Rock Hotel November 2022
text: Rooms are great but let down by staff in the bar/restaurant as well as at the front desk.  Poor knowledge of the hotel and poor communication.  Its a shame as we have stayed in other Hard Rock hotels and expected more in New York.

title: Classic and Classy
text: Our stay was effortless at the Hard Rock Hotel.  This hotel offers the perfect balance of a well appointed quiet hotel right next to Times Square.  We were a short walk from each of the three theaters we went to for our shows, and, obviously, many more theaters are equally as close (including the James Earl Jones Theater which is across the street from the hotel).  The staff were incredible, and the rooms were quiet and had many modern features for a comfortable stay.

title: Hotel is good, staff couldn’t handle their IT issue
text: I will advise future guests to prepay. I checked in and presented my card- JC said they’ve been having an issue with their payment system not taking a payment even though the screen says “accepted”, and asked me to swipe it again. The other groups at check in also had this happen. My card was authorized twice for the entire stay. I called to let them know and they told me it was only one charge. I figured a charge might fall off after the banking day- it did not. I called again and the manager had to manually remove one authorization. At check out time I settled the bill, went to the elevator, and the rep chased me down and said the payment failed (not decline) and I needed to come back. I stayed at check in for over an hour while they tried to figure it out. They asked me to call my bank- after 30 minutes on hold, my bank told me that there was no issue on my end, there had been no attempts to run the card and that the problem was the hotel’s payment system. The hotel finally ran the card and insisted it wasn’t their fault. I left for my flight over an hour late and they were unapologetic. Hotel facilities are clean and comfortable but I won’t stay there again.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Despite the name, our stay could not have been more relaxing! The staff and facilities were fantastic. Hard Rock served as our introduction to New York and our first visit to the USA and set an incredible benchmark for standards. Amazing hospitality and service. The room was very well equiped and extremely comfortable. Will definitely recommend and will look forward to the possibility of future stays! Thank you.

title: A due massi da Time Square
text: L'hotel è nuovo (aperto nell'aprile del 2022) ed è veramente molto accogliente. Sono presenti ed esposti molti cimeli di star della musica. La colazione è fantastica, la camera confortevole ma purtroppo molto rumorosa (si affaccia su una corte deve sono presenti gli impianti di climatizzazione). l personale è molto cordiale.

title: Times Square -- must stay at Hard Rock Hotel NYC
text: Hard Rock Hotel NYC is a different vibe and environment than any other hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC. From curbside bellhop customer experience, through check in, to room amenities, view, location and the way through curbside departure - this was a top notch excellent experience. Located  heart1 block from the heart of times square, you won't find a better location / experience!!

title: 5 Stars
text: Beautiful Hotel the rooms are depending on which room you choose. Well thought out layout for the space that’s available. Price is at a premium but it’s Nyc. Food was very good from Sessions, the view from RT60 roof top bar and lounge was amazing. Drinks were also delicious!!!!

title: A great way to experience NY
text: First trip to NY and could not have picked a better hotel in the perfect location.  Room was immaculate and looked new.  The gym was well equipped.  Food and drinks menu was a little small would be my only improvement.  Will definitely be back!!!

title: Clean room and Excellent Service!
text: I have stayed in many hotels when I visit NYC, and this by far is the best! The room was spacious and clean! The decor was 5 star! The amenities were awesome! The fees were a bit of a surprise so beware of the parking fees because they tacked on extra 50 bucks. Overall my experience was excellent! Right in the heart of Time Square!

title: Beautiful room-perfect NYC getaway
text: Located in Times Square- beautiful views! Celebrated my son’s 16th & 13th Birthdays and they had a blast! Feel like royalty- room service was great! You won’t be disappointed! Food was delicious. Friendly staff.

title: Winter NYC Visit
text: Lovely hotel in a central location Super clean throughout including all multi user areas Spacious rooms with great AV Friendly staff that were very helpful when needed All in all A1 experience at Hard Rock

title: Almost perfect visit
text: We stayed here booking 3 rooms after the NYC marathon. Check in was swift, we were told the pack and play / cribs would be sent to 2 of our rooms for the one year olds.After returning from dinner, no pack and play/cribs we’re in the room yet. After calling the front desk, we were told they don’t have pack and plays, just cribs. This was unacceptable as anyone w children or in the business would know to send either to a room w toddlers! The crib arrived in one room. The second room received a visit from a staff member to ask if a crib was still needed. Seriously? Other than this exasperating issue , the hotel is beautiful, the staff, friendly and professional, location is excellent. We will be back!

title: Very good
text: Overall you have a nice place to be. Your employee, your food, your rooms and places are excellent. Besides The Hard Rock Hotel is ubicated  near Time Square where you can find what ever you like. Congratulation!!!!

title: Rock Star Hotel
text: Very clean, Rooms were upgraded with wonderful amenities and have everything you need for your visit. Great Safe atmosphere with great food and is not over-crowded like the Marriott Marquis. It was only a quick walk to Time Square and top restaurants!

title: Very nice stay. Nice hotel and the service was great. Very nice staff.
text: Stayed at the Hard rock because I liked where it was located. Thought the hotel was very nice. Rooms were clean and well decorated. Nice bathroom. All of the staff we dealt with were fantastic. Friendly and professional. I’d stay there again.

title: Very loud and overpriced
text:
Very loud hotel, unpleasant music at anytime of the day and night.
The alarm went on at 1AM and again at 8:30 AM. we spent 1h in the street without any fire department being alerted,  which is not normal nor reassuring for such a big hotel!
we had to ask for soap and shampoo refills which we didn,t get otherwise
Overpriced, they block 100$/night for the minibar which is empty

title: Safe place for luggage, don’t expect to get any sleep!
text:
Tried three separate rooms and all noisy from outside noise, doors being slammed through the night, a fire alarm going off at 1am, then again later that morning, and other residents screaming as they get back to the hotel. 
Not the cheapest hotel so personally expect more, did report to hotel and whilst other rooms offered and tried they accepted that was all they could do.

title: J. Cole is in the building.
text: We had such a fun stay! Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Steven (J. Cole) at the front desk was great! We ran into him a few times in the lobby or on the elevator, and he was genuinely interested in our stay, and if we had fun the night before. He even gave us great recommendations for dinner and drinks in the area. We would definitely stay here again, and hopefully all the same people are working!

title: Location and friendly staff
text:
We were on a trip for fun and chose this hotel for the midtown location and the reviews of helpful staff. Every single person we encountered at Hard Rock was helpful and friendly! Really makes a difference. 
They did everything possible to make our stay comfortable. The rooms are small but very quiet and comfortable. Appreciated having coffee in the room and the daily water bottles were nice as well. Loved how easy it was to walk right out the door to many of the points of interest for us. So close to Broadway shows, Bryant Park, 5th Ave. We also walked to Central Park (about 15-20 minutes uptown). The rooftop bar was a lovely place to wind down with a cocktail after a long day exploring. Make reservations to be sure to get a coveted spot on the terrace and bring a warm wrap. It's beautiful out there-even if a bit chilly. I recommend sipping a Manhattan. We had one night mid stay where the fire alarm went off...turned out to be a faulty alarm and the following morning we were generously and quickly compensated for the inconvenience. They say they will be happy to improve your stay however they can and they mean it.

title: Big Apple Experience
text: Incredible 5-night stay which included taking in most of the major attractions and experiencing various dining venues. The Hard Rock lived up to every expectation, with special kudos to their Concierge service provided by; Michael Stewart.

title: Excelente location
text: excellent service, espectacular location , subway is within one block , 5th avenue 3 blocks away, time square right nest corner .  the hotel is new so everything is clean, smells great , great service.

title: Very Good
text: Very good for all, only a problem with the fire alert during the night, For the rest room and areas wonderful. Room service fast and good quality. Checkin and check out ok. Perfect position to visit all the city

title: Not really a 5* hotel
text:
I shared a queen room with my 2 adult children, we were in the city to support my brother and cousin who were running the NYC marathon. 

The room was quite small, whilst this is generally expected for NY hotels, it was smaller than other comparable hotels that I've stayed in previously whilst in the city.  

The transparent bathroom door and lack of hooks for hanging wet towels was less than ideal especially when sharing with other adults. The shower curtain and controls, were also not what we were expecting from a 5* hotel. 

The fire alarm went off for quite a while during the early hours on marathon day, the tannoy system told us to stay where we were whilst it was being investigated before eventually advising that it was a false alarm - it stopped before going off again!  Not ideal for the runners or spectators staying in the hotel, and made the Sunday a very long day indeed! 

On the plus side, the hotel was very central (1-2 mins to Times Square)  the beds were comfortable and the A/C was especially welcome! 

Unfortunately, the positives wouldn't persuade me to stay again, I'd opt instead for the Crown Plaza or Hilton Midtown (both 4*) which have slightly more generous rooms and facilities that equal (if not better) the HR Hotel - unfortunately they had no availability for the dates that we needed though.

title: Friendly Staff  & TINY Rooms
text: Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a deluxe king room and it was TINY. We lived in the city for 20 years so we know small rooms but even for NY it was surprising. I'd try to spring for a bigger room if you can.  We were traveling oversees after our stay and had 4 average size bags for 2 of us and had a hard time fitting all of them and being able to walk around the bed. The fire alarm was mistakenly activated at 1 am and it took about an hour to be resolved so that was annoying since we were getting up early to run the marathon. Hotel is pretty close to times square so if you want to be in the middle of everything it's a good location but the area around is pretty seedy so I wouldn't stay there again for that reason. Easy to get to the subway, shopping and Restaurants though.

title: Great NYC hotel for Times Square experience.
text: We came to NY to see a few Broadway shows and the HRH was perfect for us. Friendly staff, really nice room and a wonderful location. It was more than we wanted to spend (discovered later our stay was during the weekend of the NY marathon) but the HRH was actually a few $$ cheaper than the other 4-5 star hotels in the area. All in all it was perfect for us!

title: NYC Marathon
text: Hotel was great and brand new.   The only downfall was the fire alarm going off in the middle of the night for a hour, with loud announcements and bells. The night before my husband was to run the NYC marathon.  The alarm still went off the next morning.  We stayed in the city, even though we live next door to CT so he could get the rest he needed.  This was the only downfall of the trip.

title: Very nice hotel to be in but very problematic
text:
This hotel was one of a kind to look at I couldn’t fault it in any way at all .

Unfortunately due to problems with the fire alarms in the hotel which really did ruin our trip due to being constantly tired and fatigued but apart from that the hotel was spot on!

title: Excellent hotel!
text:
Amazing hotel! From the moment we were greeted at the entrance by Chester to being checked-in by Steven, our stay was amazing!  The rooms were  immaculately clean, spacious, and well-appointed. Spacious closet, safe, coffee machine, drawer space, table with two chairs, outlets with usb ports, lighting that you can press for mood lighting (welcome, relax, sleep, etc). 

One of the greatest parts of this hotel is the music experience. Music plays in the elevators, on the TV with playlists, at the restaurant. The TV also had music channels and a Broadway channel.  There is wonderful music memorabilia and posters with music facts all over. 

What will keep you coming back to this hotel is the staff! They are so thoughtful! Me and my best friend were celebrating our birthdays, and they sent us wine and cupcakes! And most importantly birthday cards! It was such a lovely touch. Made us feel special and truly welcomed. 

These are the hotel staff who truly made our stay:

Chester 
Steven
Joel
David
Ryan 
Luis (black car driver)

And so many more (I wish had gotten everyone’s names). 

We will definitely be back!

title: Terrible Experience on first stay
text: The hotel didn’t have a crib for our 2 year old.l even though we request one in advance. She couldn’t sleep all night. On top of that the fire alarm went off 3 times throughout the night keeping us all up before the nyc marathon. The light connected to the fire alarm in the room was flashing the entire night even when the alarm was off. The staff was rude when you asked to find a solution to the problem. No one apologized or tried to make up for this terrible inconvenience.

title: Good not great
text: Staff are not always very alert. Went to get coffee and girl behind counter too involved with her cell phone to notice me. No one says good morning. Fire alarm ruined the night. No compensation. Nothing.

title: Great hotel but for us location was in the end not nice
text: If you want to be in the centre of Manhattan, close to everything, choose this hotel! It is literally 2 minute walk from your room to Times square. Hotel is nice, clean, modern, people working there are also nice. Our view was "ok", nothing special, some times square billboards. Rooms are nice, but if you are traveling with someone you are not comfort with, you should know that bathrom is not separated, shower and toilete yes, but sink and etc is right in room, so you will not have complete privacy.  Although hotel was great, in the end we regreted choosing it, but only because it was in the middle of biggest crowd, if you only go two blocks from there, it's much nicier. Times square is too crowded, dirty, loud, actualy nothing to see but walk in crowd. Hotels rooftop bar was nice, ok view and great coctails.

title: Almost Pitch Perfect
text:
If you are looking for a central hotel in New York, then the Hard Rock Hotel is it. I particularly like the high standard of room finish, paired with the soundproofed rooms. Literally, you hear no noise from the bustling Times Square right outside, not any of the clubs or restaurants in the hotel. Even though it can get super loud outside the building, you will not hear a pin drop once in your room. 

The hotel also has a great personality, with different memorabilia on each floor to check out. Even the elevators always have great music in them! I have never stayed in a hotel with such a high specification, particularly in terms of the bathroom. In my opinion, the rooms alone are beyond 5-star, and I would definitely return here.

Look closely, and you’ll see hints of music such as plectrums on the door latch and the shape of guitars in the bed linen. Those beds by the way are so comfortable you’ll have one of the best sleeps of your life. 

As the hotel is new, you are one of the first people to stay in the rooms and it shows. Each day, the rooms are cleaned to perfection with immaculate attention to detail. The hotel also provides some complimentary amenities including coffee and water which is a nice touch. 

When you leave the hotel, there are always taxis hanging about to get to the airport easily. Being right in Times Square, you will not struggle to find any amenities within a short walk. 

However, just a couple of points where some improvements may be needed. 

Halfway through my stay, I went out to get coffee only to return to find my room locked. It turned out my card hadn’t been swiped at check-in so they locked my room on me in case of ‘incidentals’. This was a bit abrupt considering I’d paid in full and this wasn’t my mistake. It took some time to resolve the issue at reception. The first agent told me my ‘check out time’ was at 12pm - I told her I wasn’t leaving for another two days. She then simply said she couldn’t help me any further and that someone else needed to take over. A bit more customer service training is needed there I’m afraid. I shouldn't be locked out of a room I've paid for.

Also, the hotel emails you several times prior to and during your stay. I am on holiday (vacation) I do not check my emails during this time, so that’s kind of annoying if I’m honest. I spend all my time checking emails when working, so I don’t do this when I’m supposed to be relaxing. 

Finally, the bar in the hotel, while lovely, is eye-wateringly expensive. My boyfriend was charged for a whiskey that was barely a few raindrops worth in a glass. We ran up a $$$ figure bar bill very quickly, so it’s perhaps a place to try once but we wouldn’t pay for that each night. 

Overall, a wonderful stay in terms of the building itself and location - there's just a few refinements needed purely on the customer service side.

title: Sur côté pour un 5* … trop bruyant
text: Hôtel récent donc literie au top - douche spacieuse malgré une petite salle de bain - nous étions en étage élevé avec une chambre sur arrière mais bruit infernal la nuit car ventilation des autres immeubles - Hotel mal isolé sur ses parois vitrées dans la chambre : froid ++ malgré temps clément - petit déjeuner trop cher pour des portions minimes - trop bruyant sur les parties communes - fermeture à 22h des cuisines , personnel peu agréable dans l ensemble -

title: Best NYC Hotel
text: It’s our first time to visit new york and fortunately hallowen was on date. The staff in this hotel was so nice and treats us as a guess with pleasant even when we’re not familiar with hallowen 😁 Mark is one staff that impressed us a lot by his charming and loveable gesture to everyone. Hopefully we can get there again

title: Exceptional experience
text: Great location and looks fantastic. Close to parking garages and not difficult to park. I was very happy to with my stay and hope to be back with my son soon! I did not have time to try the food due to my class schedule but I was very pleased with my stay.

title: Topissime
text: Emplacement idéal, chambre très confortable avec douche spacieuse. Bien insonorisée et climatisée. Le personnel est très agréable et serviable. Chambre faite tous les jours. Petits déjeuners un peu chers mais beaucoup de possibilités à proximité

title: Rockshot
text: Did some fun shopping at the Hard Rock store.  “Mark” was soo very helpful showing me new merchandise and finding the sizes I needed.  Then suggested an amazing collector bottle of mens cologne with a hidden feature….stop by and ask Mark to show it to you!  A great gift for a Rockstar!!  Thank you, MARK💋💋

title: So close to Times Square and yet so quiet
text: Perfectly placed in midtown Manhattan and just a few minutes walk to Times Square. Marvellous mattress which gave us the best nights' sleep of our US trip.. Reception and concierge staff were ever so helpful. Even sent up a guitar to my room !

title: Visit octubre 2022 best hotel
text: Increíble hotel, desde el chek in hasta el chek out el mejor servicio. Steven en front desk super amable al recibimiento. Todos nuestros requerimientos siempre fueron atendidos, me encantó este hotel y la ubicación increíble.

title: Best hotel in NY
text: This hotel is very well located, close to the main tourist attractions and easy access… the subway lines are close… the hotel is super safe, clean and well set up.  I highly recommend it… for sure it is among the best accommodations in NY city.

title: Awesome place to stay
text: Our family of four had a great time staying here and were very well looked after! The staff were always very pleasant and made our children feel welcome. We loved getting coffees from the cafe downstairs and we made good use of the gym.

title: Très décevant
text:
Hotel magnifique, neuf, emplacement idéal, literie parfaite...comme beaucoup d'hôtels 4* dans ce quartier. Pour moi cet hôtel est sur coté et n'est pas digne d'un 5*! 
Accueil moyen, aucune information sur l'hôtel et les services; Pas d'endroit non payant pour se retrouver entre amis en dehors des chambres...
Check out expéditif, sans facture; Arrivée en France et SURPRISE!!! Les taxes ne correspondent pas à celles indiquées lors de la réservation. Impossible d'obtenir des explications par téléphone et aucune réponse par mail! 
Déçue de cet hôtel et du manque de professionnalisme du personnel de la réception.

title: Great Location
text:
25 mtr from Times Square and a very Nice Roof Top Bar RT 60
Quality of the room was very good and the bed was fabulous.
The choice of breakfast was unbelievable and the service quick and friendly 
The knowledge from the conciërge was very helpfull to find our way in New York.

title: Vandeputte-Dobbelaere
text: Wij bezochten laatst de rockshop in New York en werden fantastisch geholpen door de super vriendelijke en behulpzame Marck. Na de goeie service kregen we ook nog een lekkere kop koffie aangeboden. 👍👍👍

title: Great new hotel in Time Square
text:
The hotel and it's staff provide an amazing experience especially with it's location to Time Square and Midtown.  The ambiance is spot-on and eclectic!  The Sessions bar (2nd Floor) area offers welcoming vibes as you check-in to the hotel.  Be sure to make your way up to RT60 on the 34th Floor to enjoy some drinks and spectacular view from the rooftop seating area.  Our room was serviced daily and attention to detail put in to every visit.  

The balcony suite upgrade was on the 5th Floor but still provided a side-view image of Time Square.  For Apple iPhone users:  Be sure to use the address of the hotel as the iMap will default the Hard Rock Hotel to the Rock Rock Cafe which is 6 blocks away.  That is unless you want to take in the extra steps through Time Square.  SMILE

title: NYC Weekend
text: hotel is a short walk to Times Square and all the theaters, hop on bus is right there safe well lite area lots to see and dine, a wonderful way to get out a live the adventure.  People watching is defiantly an adventure

title: Rundum sehr gut!
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut. Das Personal ist überaus freundlich und zuvorkommend. 
Die Zimmer sind neu und das Housekeeping ist exzellent. Unser Zimmer war jeden Tag sehr sauber und auch liebevoll hergerichtet. Das Steakhouse im Erdgeschoss ist ausgezeichnet. Wir haben dort sehr gut gegessen. 
Auch die Bar im obersten Stockwerk ist einen Besuch wert. 
Wir waren insgesamt überaus zufrieden und können dieses Hotel jedenfalls empfehlen.

title: Pin-O-Ween
text: I've never stayed in NYC before,  but the hotel exceeded my expectations.  I wish I could stay here more often, but unfortunately life has other plans for me.  I had a wonderful time and I hope I can do it again.

title: Lovely trip
text:
Very nice hotel; there were a few room related difficulties, but they were resolved. The cleanliness of the hotel was amazing, and it smelled wonderful as soon as you walked in. Being a bit of a neat freak and a fan of spotless settings, I had the impression that my trip had been worthwhile. This was exactly how a hotel should be. 

The only thing about this hotel that irritates me is that they don't offer a breakfast buffet like every other five-star hotel does. Instead, they have a $25 menu that only includes 2 pastries, fruit, juice and tea. The price should be between $25 and $30 per person and the menu should include a buffet breakfast to let you realise you're genuinely on vacation. The staff was wonderful only some need a little more customer service experience. If I ever travel to New York again, I'll absolutely book this again.

title: Perfect hotel with service minded staff
text: The hotel is perfectly located in the center close to everything. The building is new and the rooms very clean and modern. Last but not least the staff is as efficient, friendly and service minded. A perfect stay and perfect hotel I highly recommend

title: Bien mais déçus
text: Assez bon accueil. Le studio suite n'était pas aussi grand que nous le pensions. La salle de bain est magnifique et la chambre aussi. Par contre le bruit venant de l'extérieur nous a empêché de dormir comme il faut. Nous étions pourtant dans un étage très élevé. Nous avons été très déçus car quelques jours avant notre arrivée à l'hôtel, nous avons envoyé plusieurs e-mails qui sont restés sans réponse. C'est assez honteux pour un 5 étoiles. Nous demandions si nous pouvions payer cash la chambre. A notre arrivée, nous demandions à l'employé si nous pouvions payer cash. Il nous dit oui biensûr, vous pouvez le faire lors du check out. Lors de notre check out l'employé nous dit que le montant a déjà été débité sur notre carte de crédit. Nous étions très fachés car bien évidemment la carte de crédit nous avait pris des frais de commissions et comme nous avions pris du cash exprès nous n'avons pas compris comment l'employé avait pu nous dire oui et que lors du checkout on nous dit que tout a été payé. Il devrait revoir le personnel qui check les e-mails et qu'il donne des informations cohérentes au client. Pour toutes ces raisons nous ne reviendrons pas

title: Location. Bling Roof TOP wow
text: Hotel was very modern. Location great. Views from room NONE but environment great …Bar nice rooms were clean. Bling. Great —— the roof top bar was awesome like wow. The one thing that let them down 2nd floor bar staff were amateurs no Hustle if sense urgency lots people doing NOTHING whilst service vv slow

title: Excellent honneymoon
text: Everyone was friendly and the location was perfect. All room requests were promptly and in abundance. It was a hotel that partially reflected the requirements of the honeymoon and fully reflected the customer's story.

title: New hotel in the heart of Times Square with some interesting artist memorabilia
text: Great property.  Everything looks new and modern.  Close to all the action in Times Square.  The lobby is stunning. Gym was clean and great front desk service.  Get a cool shirt in their shop and sit in the lobby and enjoy the ambiance.

title: Cafe visit
text: As we could not afford to stay here we popped in for a coffee fantastic staff lovely and friendly the drinks were nice the sandwich a little hard for $15 dollars but this place is amazing a gem in Times Square one  day I will be able to afford to stay

title: Habitación Superior sin vistas

El hotel es nuevo y con buenas instalaciones. Las habitaciones son chicas pero esto es NY, algo normal.

title: NYC
text: Excellent hotel , Great Service. Can’t wait to come back . From the moment you pull up outside there so  A tentative, New yankee steak house was fantastic. So much fun on thee rooftop bar , great music

title: Very Nice Hôtel
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel, the staff is so nice and up front your needs. Rooms are clean and cozy. Right next to time square, its the perfect spot if you want to enjoy NYC and all the shopping.

title:
Rock Star Service All
Around

title: Very great hotel ❤️

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Hotel in a great location for all New York sites . Hotel is spotless , rooms very comfortable and a good size for New York hotel rooms. Staff are incredible, extremely helpful and a pleasure to deal with . Our goto hotel in New York , we look forward to visiting again soon.

title: Amazing, great location.

title: Great six days in the centre of NYC
text:
Excellent hotel at the centre of the city close to all the attractions. The staff are very friendly like to help as much as needed. We had a nice room very quite (despite the fact that the hotel is very close to time square).
I would like to mention the very efficient check in we did with Tiffany and the same while checking out by Julia.
The hotel have a great Bar on floor 34 which we used every day before competing the day. Try it.

title: City break
text: The hotel has a great vibe for both business and pleasure trips, excellent location in Midtown Manhattan but still quiet at night, very well presented, rooms small but you expect that in NYC. Great outside seating in the RT60 lounge bar overlooking Times Square from 34th floor, try and find out what the RT stands for - it's not Roof Top!

title: Comfortable in the heart of the city
text: New hotel, located right next to Times Square so very convenient if you want to catch the buzz there or the shows on broadway. Courteous and friendly staff with one exception (don't remember his name, was at the front desk while we were checking in). Room was adequate for us. The bathroom was a bit tiny but clean and modern.Great rain shower. Regular house keeping was done. Promptly gave us as many bottles of water whenever we requested each day. Room was at the 27th floor, so was very quiet, though the view was nothing to talk about. Pet friendly hotel. Would surely recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

title: Jasna made the Big Apple great again!
text: The facility and staff were amazing! The only reason not to give it a 5 was the missing pool... We found the rooftop bars to be very nice! The location of the property is very convenient. The Cafe was nice. The property was very clean.

title: 10/10 experience
text: First time in NYC since pre-covid. All and all 10/10 experience. Entire staff was helpful throughout the weekend. Especially the bell staff Adi & Joel were always first to greet us help out and give us local recommendations.

title: Great location! Excellent customer service!
text: Everything was great from the check in staff to the valet & bellman. Comfortable beds & great shower! Super cute rooms ! Miguel G helped us checkout and even helped us get our bags to the next  block since our street was blocked off. Great location to Times Square. If you go to club on the top floor make sure you make reservations. It stays busy. Great views of the city and lots of places to take photos ! Will be back!

title: Anniversary trip
text: Our entire experience from check in to check out was memorable.  Excellent customer service, super comfortable room, we slept so well.  We did wander into the roof top bar area but it wasn't our scene so we left to check out other places. This hotel offers a lot of modern amenities and we enjoyed the musical artifacts shown throughout the hotel.  It's in a great location that's close to all the action of Times Square but very quiet inside the rooms.

title: Great location, friendly staff!
text:
Minutes in walking distance to the theater. 
Hotel new, clean and staff was accommodating.  I would recommend and stay again. A few improvements with rooms requested and reservations. Black out curtains, refrigerator and coffee maker was a nice plus!

title: Not a nice view
text: Amazing hotel … lovely clean rooms … small bath .. no wear to hang towels … no storage for 3 people sharing … no night light when required to use toilet … view was boring considering I paid a lot of money … breakfast expensive … staff will not leave you alone when eating … hotel in great place for time square .. staff friendly .. would visit again definately

title: Best location
text: I stay here with my friends ..we had so good experience here as we spent so good quality time here.. their ambitious are so beautiful.. they had so tasty food ...their terrace part is so good ...it's over all a pleasant place ....all in perfect ratio

title: Location, location, location and location
text: Brilliant location on Times Square. Friendly staff, great vibe and one thing I guarantee is a good nights sleep. The mattress is something else, very comfortable. I actually want one for my home now. The Big bus tour stop is around a 2mins walk to get to and you can more or less tick off many things tourism wise as the location is pretty much bang center. Will definitely be going back next year. Thank you to everyone involved at the Hard Rock.

title: An Exceptional Hotel
text:
Being a first time NYC visitor, I was worried about hotel costs & conditions in the city but this hotel was absolutely perfect. The spaces are clean and well maintained. The rooms are cleverly designed and built with incredibly effective blackout curtains which helped tune out our awesome view of Times Square at night. Also incredibly quiet - shockingly so, considering you are truly in the heart of everything. 

I had no expectations for the coffee shop (having worked in hotels for a decade, I know that F&B outlets can be mediocre) but by the end of our 5 night stay I’d tried a number of coffee shops in the area and none had coffee as good or a team so lovely as the Hard Rock’s lobby. Gabriel is extraordinary and the world needs more of him. I nominate him if we start cloning people. 

Would 100% stay again. 

As for the city, it’s a great time. People are friendlier than I expected, every restaurant has been exceptional and even in the rain I’ve loved exploring Manhattan.

title: Smart and Clean Hotel
text:
Had a wonderful trip as always whenever I visit, you can’t deny it’s one of the greatest places on earth! 

First time staying at the hard rock New York. 
On arrival check in was smooth and quick with very friendly staff members. 

The room was a good size, the beds weren’t as big as we were thinking but they were very comfortable. So that’s all that mattered to us. 

A lovely clean and functional bathroom, just a little thing however there is no where to hang your wet towels after a shower. 

RT-60 the roof top bar is worth popping into for a drink and to enjoy the views. 

Overall a great stay and would consider staying here again.

title: Within walking distance to everything
text: This hotel has views of Times Square. It’s within walking distance to Times Square, Theater District, subways, metro bus, and  lots of food options. They are quick to solve issues or to make things right. Will come back to stay again.

title: Hard Rock Hotel New York
text: Staff are friendly and helpful. Room is a little small but nice and clean. Great location. Walking distance to major attractions. Try to get a room a little further from the elevator. It's a little noisy something.

title: New Hotel and Very good location
text: Checked in last minute, in the evening. Room was on point. Clean, well furnished, my room view was very nice and the bed was comfortable. Roof Top bar and patio are a cool bonus! Very convenient location, in Times Square, not too far from Central Park. Beware of a "residence fee" they charge at checkout.

title: Great hotel…but avoid the breakfast at all costs!!!
text:
Great hotel for exploring Times Square & the Theatre District. Front desk, concierge and especially the cleaner (on floor 20) extremely helpful and pleasant. Rooms small, but that’s pretty standard for the area…but functional, new and incredibly clean. Memorabilia really good as you’d expect from a Hard Rock. 
The negative…and it’s a huge one! DON’T DO BREAKFAST here! Shocking! Waited an hour for food, we noticed it went to a table near us, they realised their mistake (without telling us!), collected it and returned it to the kitchen hoping we wouldn’t notice! It then came out a full 15 minutes later…cold, poor quality and no apologies! I put to the server my aforementioned comments, still no apology, only an offer to ‘heat it up’!!! Shambolic!!! Got the bill, charged extortionate full price!!! Fortunately front desk redeemed the situation a little when we checked out by removing from the final bill. Awful experience, needless to say we never eat there again! Find a decent local diner instead…at at least half the cost for a better quality of food and experience!

title: Excellent Location and Customer Service
text:
I booked a stay for a Father/Trip and had a few special requests. I had the pleasure of being assisted by Gina and she made everything just perfect. We arrived early and our room was available for an early check in. The rooms are small but it is New York and that is what we expected, however the cleanliness and modern amenities made all the difference.  
The hotel staff were pleasant and so accommodating, especially appreciated the sweet treats upon arrival and the late check out!
Location could not have been better!

title: Worth trying if you have not had the opportunity uet
text: Employees anticipated my needs and ultimately saved me time. Having been a few times to the hotel it feels as though it has been around for a long time although only opening in April. Worth trying if you have not been already.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: I stayed here during the year with my family. We had an amazing time, all of the staff were lovely. From the front desk team right through to the housekeepers. all of the facilities are well maintained. We will definitly be back!!

title: 3 star hotel
text: My family and I book 3 rooms for September. Rooms are very small and very hot. We sweat all of the 3 nights and it was very difficult to sleep. I book a suite, we’re supposed to have a room with tub and couple complimentary drinks, that did not happened. Very expensive for the experience. Breakfast was ok, but it takes forever. For the price I would book somewhere else.

title: Fees
text: The stay was great. The location was good. The staff was good. Unfortunately, I didn't know there was an additional residence fee per each day I stayed.  I stayed in other hotel and no additional residence fee.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: New Hotel just outside of Time Square.  Great facilities and a nice roof top bar to start your eveing or end it as we did. You can walk to most attractions.  The rooms were big enough and the staff were fantastic.  A fitness centre is important to us on holiday and this one is one of the best I have seen a hotel.  Clean Friendly and Convenient.

title: Hard Rock Cafe rocks
text: We love David and Ian. They rock.. haha get it? They gave us amazing recommendations  and the drinks were made well. Give these men a raise or something idk. They are great and yea. I’m also pretty sure they saved orphan puppies from a fire

title: Great location, good rooms, gorgeous decoration
text: This hotel is impressive. The rooms are not that big but very comfortable and clean. The staff is pleasant and very competent. Great location and attractive decoration. I shall definitely come back and my grownp up children, who were delighted, probably will too.

title: Novo MAS…
text: O hotel é novo, limpo, sofisticado, limpeza excelente, café da manhã delicioso no atendimento impecável do Sr, Pedro, MAS possui um sistema de insuflação forcada de ar ao lado da cama que não desliga nunca e gela o quarto, para nós foi torturante, noites em estado de alerta.

title: Great location
text: Great value for a conveniently located hotel to the theater district and many nearby restaurants . Hotel is very new and Immaculately clean.  Efficient checkin and checkout. Only criticism was breakfast. Recommend walking a few blocks to go to a local place.

title: City break
text: New hotel with modern facilities, clean and efficient, staff in bars, restaurants and lobby really helpful. We took the breakfast inclusive option which was a bit tedious for 7 day stay as was basic continental. No allowances made against the a la carte which would have been good (even a request for decaf coffee was chargeable) House keeping very efficient and good.

title: Annual NY Aunt/ Niece tradition
text: My niece and I take a trip to NY annually to attend the Global Citizen Festival in Central Park. This year we have decided to stay at Hard Rock hotel and after staying here this hotel will also be our annual tradition. Hotel was clean, modern, and spacious with very friendly staff! We had a great time. Attended our concert, spent the day at the Italian festival, attended the Broadway show Beetlejuice, ate at Ellen’s Stardust (another annual tradition), did a lot of shopping, and of course took in other New York must see highlights.

title: Incredible weekend!
text:
We had an amazing time at the Hard Rock this weekend! All previous reviews are spot on- every staff member was extremely courteous, the hotel is gleaming clean, and our suite was spacious, comfortable, and has all the right amenities! 
We did not get a chance to eat at the steakhouse or order breakfast but the RT60 bar was great- beautiful views and fantastic music! 
We would highly recommend the Hard Rock to anyone looking for an amazing midtown hotel!

title: Great and quality hotel
text:
An excellent hotel with a good vibe and amazing design. 
Our room was comfortable and modern with a relaxing atmosphere.
The hotel staff was helpful and professional, especially the concierge who helped us plan a trip to the park.

title: Very Nice Hotel
text: Never stayed at a Hard Rock hotel and this place did not disappoint!  The entire hotel was decorated tastefully, including the room.  Very clean and comfortable, I'll be looking to stay at this hotel chain in the future for sure.

title: Amazing property
text: Amazing property with very friendly and helpful staff.  The rooms were really nice and clean and the food was good as well.   We loved the cupcakes that were left for us to celebrate my friends birthday.

title: Great new fun hotel right in TImes Square
text: Great service and location, cool rooms with lots of Rock memorabilia throughout the building and a nice roof-bar.  Also got a pretty good rate even though it was UN General Assembly week.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Glamorous, Beautiful, new hotel but beware
text:
Stayed 5 nights September. Booked via Agoda. 
Stayed 9th floor. Reception on floor 2.. not ground. 

Good sized rooms for NYC. 

On check in took $100 x 5 pending. Also took £1126 - which was a mistake & reversed. 

On check out they took £1545! I noticed before I left the hotel. They again reversed. Same excuse.. didnt realise was pre paid via Agoda. Absolute bull. Ive left to return to the UK with £2700 pending on my credit card.  Ive heard this has happened to others. 

Bar was lovely & great location. I would stay again… when the $ improves. 

Stayed at London & Tenerife HR hotels prior. Staff are nicer in these two but I guess this is NYC & the people are different.,

title: Excellent service
text: Great staff made you feel welcome and at home. Great room with even better location. Would recommend to stay here since it is close to Time Square, Tavern on the green- 20 walk, shops are  all walking distance

title: Great service awesome vibes
text: We just went to the Rock Shop and Mark was very kind and helpful. Were looking for gifts to bring back home and were not dissapointed. Beautiful goods, and the smell of coffee inside the store makes you want to stay there

title: Small rooms, awesome vibe, even better staff!
text: The Hard Rock will now be one of our NYC favorites! From the moment we pulled up and Jonathan (valet/door) greeted us, we knew we had chosen the right hotel.  Brittany at the front desk went above and beyond to help us ensure we had the Hard Rock experience we were hoping for. This was definitely the most expensive NYC weekend we’ve ever had but…. It was WORTH IT. We ended up with a Platinum Suite with balcony. The room was stunning! The other rooms were very small (even the regular suites). NYC is notorious for small rooms so this didn’t come as a complete surprise to us. While most rooms are small, they make up for it with decor and comfort. THE STAFF is what made us fall in love with the hotel. The bartenders were friendly (and made excellent cocktails). The waitstaff at Seasions (breakfast) were helpful and eager to please. You never felt like any of the staff interactions were forced or fake. Coffee shop staff (so friendly)…. Overall we had an ideal stay and we couldn’t be more happy. I hope they continue with this culture of excellence because we were impressed to say the least! Kudos Hard Rock! You have the BEST STAFF OUT THERE!!!

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
It was a lovely stay to celebrate our anniversary, very nice n new hotel with friendly staffs, everything was perfect the way it was, we stayed for 4 nights.
Thank you Mark from cafe n Ms liang from check in 
 Definitely will stay again if we back to NY

title: Great weekend stay
text: My daughters and I came to NY for my birthday and to see a show. The HardRock hotel was so much fun!  The staff is outstanding. My daughters loved playing the Fender guitar. The rooftop bar is a great space.  The hotel is cool, sleek, safe and clean. We loved staying there.

title: Nice Hotel!
text: It’s a Beautiful Hotel.  Convenient to all of NYC. Definitely clean.  The rooftop bar was extremely nice.  Felt like a luxury hotel.  The staff is very pleasant. Lounge areas are very comfortable.  Food and Drink are Fabulous.

title: review
text:
what a great hotel.
everybody is so friendly, the service is perfect and the rooms are magnificent.
Also the shop inside provides delicieus coffee. The last ones I spoke where Veronica and Gabriel, many thanks for them to.

title: False Advertisement of Two Queen Rooms
text: Booked this hotel based on the fact they were one of the only hotels in Times Square that advertised a "Two Queen" hotel room. Room was tiny and the beds were NOT queens, they were the smaller full size bed. Checked out within 20 minutes of checking in, we had barely touched the room, and hotel said they still had to charge us 1 full night's stay. Will be disputing with my credit card due to false advertisement of the two Queen beds.

title: Amazing hotel, and would recommend
text:
Love my stay, feels safe, always clean. 
Downside - our server at RT and Sessions were not friendly! But overall the front house staff were amazing and the aesthetic of HR is amazing beyond compare to others

title: Soo disappointing
text:
Arrived Wednesday night after a full day of travel from Scotland.
When we arrived, hotel looked lovely, however
Went up to room and was tiny, with 2 double beds that are advertised as queens, staff looking at me like I was nuts saying they were queen size.
I’ve stayed at hard Orlando numerous times and the bed are queens and are huge.
5 mins after we got in our room, fire alarm went off, called reception…no answer so we went down 18 flights of stairs with asthmatic daughter in tow to reception to staff that were not really interested. Said oh it’s just a false alarm.
Went back up to room and it was going off for 20mins ( which is super loud) , daughter now upset as absolutely shattered and can not sleep with the noise.
Went and spoke to manager who’s attitude was awful, was not apologetic at all and was clearly not interested.
Have never been so disappointed in a hotel in my life, we were treated with no care or respect at all.
We had been up for nearly 20 hours and had to go find another hotel and ended up out of pocket as paid more as hadn’t booked in advance.

title: Maaaan, NICE!!! 😊
text:
Wonderful hotel & we are hotel snobs!!  It was VERY clean & still looks very new!  Staff was very courteous, service was prompt!  It’s literally in the heart of Times Square!  You go out of the entrance, look right & you see the lights of Times Sq!!  I thought it was going to be @ least a couple of blocks walk, but not even!!! We could even see a partial view of the Times Sq lights from our 21st floor room. 
We’re on our way from NC to Singapore & Bali, flying out of JFK.  This could possibly be our ‘place’ whn we fly out of JFK, BUT you need to consider the cost to get to & from JFK to the hotel… $$$$$, but it's worth it!!  Uber is $60 to $100 each way.  You can also arrive early enough to take the Metro (our flight out of Raleigh was delayed & we didn’t arrive to NY til 9p) - then we’d planned on catching the Metro this am for cheap, but we lingered over a delicious rm svc ‘brekkie’ & got a late start….. Soooooo we’re Ubering back 2 JFK.  The Metro takes an hr to 1.5hrs, something like that.  

Breakfast is delicious & $$$$$ - 3 entree’s + tip, $150 😬, but worth it!! I’m only posting pics of the room service menu bc it seems that no one ever posts that.  I always like to know what’s offered.  That’s important!! 

Please follow my travel blog:
mssassytravels.com

title: Persistent Fire Alarm Malfunctions!!!
text: I stayed for 3 nights and on two of them there were issues with the fire alarm. First it was in the middle of the night and the second time it went on for 30 minutes! It was maddening and stressful. It ruined my sleep and I felt like crap the next day. I won’t be coming back.

title: Room mix up but great stay with pleasant staff - Stayed 28th July - 1st August
text:
If you want the short version - modern feel with great staff and location but hotel layout not perfect.

For the main review, As stated by previous guests the location is world class and you won’t really get much better. In one direction around 5 minutes away is Rockefeller centre and the other direction is a stones throw away from Times Square which both have a metro station next to it to get you to other locations around New York in no time.

We arrived and were warmly greeted by the staff in the downstairs lobby, who I must say greet you each and every time they spot you which is a nice touch and feels very accommodating. 

At the Check in desk we were warmly greeted and offered a bottle of water from the fridge. 

The ladies at check in were very pleasant however we did have a slight issue with our room that had being booked. It was pre-booked before the hotel had even opened its doors at the beginning of the year in late February but when we arrived on the day we were told that this room was not available and was currently being occupied. However after speaking to the staff they managed to upgrade us and made sure we had a similar room to the one that was booked.

The next day as an apology for the mix up a bottle of champagne was delivered to the room while we were out that was accompanied by an apology note provided by the front desk manager Amerissa P, which was not expected but very much appreciated.

The hotel itself is very modern and slick, we walked through the restaurant but didn’t eat anything so couldn’t comment on the food but from the looks it seemed nice. We did do the the RT60 bar at the top which was great and easily booked via the website. It did seem popular as we saw a few none guests and locals make their way to the bar during our stay so it seems word is getting out about it.

The check out was very smooth and we were asked if we had transportation arrangements if not they would get a taxi to pick us up which showed the standard and class of the service that had received while staying at the hotel.

The only negatives I would give the hotel is the elevators, there are only a few of them and you require them to both get to your room, check in/ out desk and the restaurant/ bar so at times it can take a while to get one as you can imagine there are quite a few floors. This being only a small detail I would still highly recommend the hotel.

title: One week at the new hard rock
text: Brand new hotel and clean, great location rooms were spacious, lifts took a while and stopped on most floors. Coffee shop was convenient in the lobby. Breakfast for 2 was over 100 dollars could be more affordable for guests. Rooftop bar was nice but have to request outside table to get one with a view. Friendly staff and would stay again when in NY.

title: Great Hotel & Great Location
text:
The customer service is a 10/10. Every single person I came in contact with - super professional. It was my daughter’s birthday and they sent up cupcakes (delicious) with a handwritten card and balloons. I asked for balloons to be ordered and placed in the room as a surprise. When we walked in the room, birthday balloons!! The room was a perfect size. Not small. My daughter loved the Lady Gaga bathroom door. If you have a teenager this is a great place. We were able to walk to a lot of places. We walked to get tickets to see a broadway show. We only took transportation to go to the museums. We ordered room service a couple of times - service 10/10. 

I could be picky and leave a bad review based on the fact that we had a major leak in our room and had to be moved after a very long day of “being a tourist”. BUT….The 2nd room was nice; even though it seemed smaller. The bathroom was a definite upgrade - loved it! Plus, I got moved to the Cyndi Lauper/Blondie floor! 

I choose to give it 5 stars based on customer service, cleanliness, and the museum feel of the hotel. I will always stay at Hard Rock hotels now.

title: Super Novo
text:
Hotel super novo, localização maravilhosa próximo a Times Square e quinta avenida.
Tem cafeteira e frigobar pequeno.
Quarto bem pequeno, como quase todos em NY mas muito agradável, ótima limpeza, conforto, arrumação nota 10 todos os dias.
Staff bem atencioso. Recomendo.

title: disappointing
text: rooms are super tiny.  Bath very small. .definitely not a 5 star. disappointing. Also because we booked with 3rd party site...given worst room possible. literally facing a brick wall on low floor. No chance to change because using a 3rd party site. Front desk not very helpful.

title: Great Gem in the Heart of Times Square!
text: My husband and I recently visited for a 2 day stay. We stayed in the superior king with a balcony which offered great views. It’s important to note that while we were on the 19th floor, most balcony rooms are on the 5th floor unless you upgrade to a suite so keep in mind the street noise. The room was amazing and clean, everything is still basically brand new. The bathroom in this room is a bit small. The vanity and mirror are in the hallway while the bathroom itself has a toilet and stand up shower with two hooks on the wall. The shower is spacious with the rainfall shower head option. We did hear the people next to use slamming doors and drawers at 2am but I bring a noise maker which helped with some of that. The hotel is fun with all of the music memorabilia and decor around. I also felt it was reasonably priced especially for the location. The subways are very close and easy, you can walk up to Rockefeller Center and Fifth Ave for shopping. I stayed about a block away earlier this summer with friends at a different hotel for around the same price and got an older room with less amenities. They offer online check in so you don’t have to wait in a line, you can just pick up your keys although there was no line by the time we arrived around 7p. Check out is easy as well, you can simply check out through text. You can also communicate with staff through text at any time also. I would definitely stay again but might opt for a larger room on a higher floor.

title: Great Location
text:
We loved our stay at the HARD ROCK! 
Close to everything and the subway is just 1 blocck away!  The beds are super comfortable with the best pillows ive ever slept on! 

Loved the fact we could wake up every morning and go right to Time Square and also grab a late nite Pizza at Little Italy next to the hotel.

title: Excellent choice!
text: Best experience I’ve had!! They surprised me with cupcakes, ballons, and a card for my birthday celebration. I absolutely love the premium suite with the balcony. Room service was fast! I don’t care for what I ordered but I loved every bit of my stay

title: Clean and Luxurious
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel.  Our room was very clean, well appointed, luxurious and quiet.  I often struggle staying at hotels because most are just downright nasty but this room was absolutely spotless, smelled clean and had everything we could want or need.  We received wonderful service at the front desk and luggage room and were always greeted with a smile when we walked in the door.  The cafe wasn't great but was a quick place to grab a cup of coffee if you don't feel like walking down the street.  My husband and I both agree that we will definitely book with this hotel again if we ever happen to re-visit New York City.  This was the best hotel experience that we have had in quite some time.

title: Great vibe and location
text: The Hard Rock Hotel provides high-end accommodations with a great rock and roll vibe and amenities in the heart of midtown with a great location near 30 Rock, 6th Avenue, and Radio City. Highly recommend.

title: Новый отель в гуще событий
text: Этот отель из-за своего месторасположения (боком смотрит на Таймс Сквер) все время бывает в гуще событий. Рядом с отелем многолюдно, весело и забавно. Чего не скажешь об отеле.
